CatDescriptText: Dr. Charles Burks, 1109 Federal Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the District Attorney's office and the courts are exerting all out efforts in prosecuting equal rights cases in which Negroes are the victims?"  Answer reads: "You can't pin it on the District Attorney's office. I don't know whose responsibility it is for the unfairness in equal rights cases about which I read."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dr. Charles Burks standing in front of brick building
